009
010package imagingbook.common.image.matching;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
014
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Instances of this class perform matching on scalar-valued images
020 * based on the correlation coefficient.
021 * The "search" image I (to be searched for matches of the "reference" image R) is
022 * initially associated with the {@link CorrCoeffMatcher}.
023 * The assumption is, that the search image I is fixed and the matcher
024 * tries to match multiple reference images R.
025 * See Sec. 23.1.1 (Alg. 23.1) of [1] for additional details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
029 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/02/10
034 * @version 2022/09/16 revised
035 */
036public class CorrCoeffMatcher {
037        
038        private final FloatProcessor I; // search image
039        private final int MI, NI;               // width/height of image
040
041        private FloatProcessor R;               // reference image
042        private int MR, NR;                     // width/height of reference
043        private int K;
044        private double meanR;                   // mean value of reference
045        private double varR;                    // square root of reference variance
046
047        /**
048         * Constructor.
049         * @param I the reference image (to be matched to)
050         */
051        public CorrCoeffMatcher(FloatProcessor I) {
052                this.I = I;
053                this.MI = this.I.getWidth();
054                this.NI = this.I.getHeight();
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Matches the specified reference image R to the (fixed) search image I.
059         * @param R some scalar-valued reference image
060         * @return a 2D array Q[r][s] of match scores
061         */
062        public float[][] getMatch(FloatProcessor R) {
063                this.R = R;
064                this.MR = R.getWidth();
065                this.NR = R.getHeight();
066                this.K = MR * NR;
067
068                // calculate the mean and variance of R
069                double sumR = 0;
070                double sumR2 = 0;
071                for (int j = 0; j < NR; j++) {
072                        for (int i = 0; i < MR; i++) {
073                                double b = R.getf(i, j);
074                                sumR  += b;
075                                sumR2 += sqr(b);
076                        }
077                }
078                
079                this.meanR = sumR / K;
080                this.varR = sqrt(sumR2 - K * sqr(meanR));
081                
082                float[][] C = new float[MI - MR + 1][NI - NR + 1];
083                for (int r = 0; r < C.length; r++) {
084                        for (int s = 0; s < C[r].length; s++) {
085                                C[r][s] = (float) getMatchValue(r, s);
086                        }       
087                }
088                this.R = null;
089                return C;
090        }
091        
092        private double getMatchValue(int r, int s) {
093                double sumI = 0, sumI2 = 0, sumIR = 0;
094                for (int j = 0; j < NR; j++) {
095                        for (int i = 0; i < MR; i++) {
096                                double a = I.getf(r + i, s + j);
097                                double b = R.getf(i, j);
098                                sumI  += a;
099                                sumI2 += sqr(a);
100                                sumIR += a * b;
101                        }
102                }
103                double meanI = sumI / K;
104                return (sumIR - K * meanI * meanR) / 
105                           (1 + sqrt(sumI2 - K * sqr(meanI)) * varR);
106                        // added 1 in denominator to handle flat image regions (w. zero variance)
107        }  
108        
109}
